properties.name: Castillo de San Marcos
properties.description: Posted by Melissa23St. Augustine, FloridaThe Monument site consists of 20.5 acres. It is the oldest masonry and only extant 17th century fort in North America. It is a great example of the "bastion system" of fortification. The construction by the Spanish, the Castillo began on October 2, 1672, and was mostly complete by 1695. The fort was built of coquina, a type of shellstone native to the area and quarried from Anastasia Island. Even though the fort has served many nations, it has never been taken by military force. In the 1870s and 1880s, the fort housed Indians detained by the U.S. Government.The Castillo was made a National Monument in 1924 and became part of the National Park system in 1933.

properties.name: Great Barrier Reef
properties.description: Posted by Melissa23Queensland, AustraliaThe Great Barrier Reef extends over 2300km along the Queensland coast. At 344,400km, the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park is the world\'s largest World Heritage Area. The Reef was declared World Heritage on 26th October 1981. The Park is bigger than New Zealand,and is roughly equal in size to Japan. The Great Barrier Reef is the only living organic thing visible on Earth seen from Earth\'s orbit. The Great Barrier Reef is also one of Australia\'s premier tourist destinations, with marine tourism annually contributing about billion to the Australian economy. The Reef has more than 1,500 species of fish, 4,000 types of mollusc and more than 200 species of bird life. 600 continental islands and 350 coral cays are spread throughout the reef. There are approximately 3400 individual reefs that make up the Barrier Reef.

properties.name: Great Wall of China
properties.description: Posted by Melissa23ChinaThe Great Wall was originally built in the Spring and Autumn as a defensive fortification by the three states: Yan, Zhao and Qin. The Great Wall began in many independent walls when it was first built. It did not become the "Great" wall until the Qin Dynasty. Emperor Qin succeeded in his effort to have the walls joined together to fend off the invasions from the Huns. The construction began in the 7th century B.C. when China was still divided into small states; and the joining of the walls began around 220 B.C. The length of the latest constructionby the Ming dynasty is over 6,ooo kilomters. Including all the walls built in different dynasties around China, the total length will exceed 50,000 kilometers. There are actually many walls built from the different states in China. The Great Wall was usually built with local materials, mostly earth and stones.The labor force was made up of three groups: soldiers, common people, and criminals. The Ming Wall is the most solid and can still be seen as a wall. While other walls are now ruins.

properties.name: Hadrian
properties.description: Posted by Melissa23EnglandHadrian\'s Wall was a stone barrier built to separate the Romans and the Picts tribes in Scotland. The Romans began building the wall in 122 A.D. There were 16 forts in total along the length of the Wall. It was 117 kilometers (73 miles) long across the narrow neck of England, from the North Sea to the Irish Sea. The wall was eight to ten feet wide and fifteen feet high. It took about 14 years to complete Hadrian\'s Wall. It was the largest structure ever made by the Romans. Roman Emperor Hadrian ordered the wall to be built.

properties.name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
properties.description: Posted by Melissa23Pisa, ItalyThe Tower of Pisa is the bell tower of the Cathedral. The construction of this tower was started in the year 1174 by Bonanno Pisano. When the tower had reached its third story the work stopped because it had started sinking into the ground. The leam was 141/2 feet out of line when measured from the seventh story. The Tower was designed to be "vertical", and started to incline during its construction. The tower was built on unsuitable ground for such a heavy and tall building. It is only about 6 feet above sea level and built on a riverbed. Because of its inclination, and its beauty, from 1173 up to now the Tower has been a very special tourist spot.

properties.name: Liberty Bell
properties.description: Posted by Melissa23Philadelphia, Pennsylvania As the official bell of the Pennsylvania State House, it rang many times for public announcements. July 8, 1776 it rang to announce the first public reading of the Declaration of Independence by Colonel John Nixon.The old State House bell was first called the "Liberty Bell" by a group trying to outlaw slavery.In the 1830s,they adopted it as a symbol of their cause.It reminded Americans of how they fought together in the early days for independence. The bell was cast in London, England, but it arrived in Philadelphia damaged. John Pass and John Stow cast a new bell in 1753, using metal from the cracked bell. The bell was cracked twice and rang for a George Washington birthday celebration. The bell weighs about 2,000 pounds. It is made of 70% copper, 25% tin, and small amounts of other minerals.

properties.name: Mount Everest
properties.description: Posted by Melissa23Nepal Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. The height is 29,028 feet, or 5 and a half miles above sea level. That is about 20 Empire State buildings. It\'s part of the Himalaya Mountain Range and is on the border of Nepal and Tibet. It was named after Sir George Everest, a British surveyor-general of India, because he was the first to record the location of Everest. Approximately 4,000 people have tried to climb the mountain. 660 have successfully climbed Mt. Everest. Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay were the first people to climb the mountain on May 29, 1953. First two women, both American, reach the summit in 1989. The wind is blowing all year long with the strength of a hurricane at 118+ miles/hour. The temperature can reach as low as 100 degrees below zero.

properties.name: That Luang
properties.description: Posted by Melissa23Vientiane, LaosAlso called the "Great Sacred Stupa", is the most important religious structure in Laos.In 1560, King Setthathirat originally built Pha That Luang on the ruins of a 13th century Khmer Temple.The Siamese military destroyed Vientiane and the temple in 1828, but the temple was finally restored in the 1990\'s to it\'s original design.The main stupa in the center of the temple is 45m high.The design refelects the shape of a lotus. As it was a time of crisis for the Lao government, the That Luang was seen as a symbol that could bring Lao people together.It symbolizes the preseverance and the generosity of the Lao people.

properties.name: The Palace of Versailles
properties.description: Posted by Melissa23FranceIt\'s one of the most extravagant buildings in the whole world. The Palace of Versailles was the official residence of the Kings of France from 1682 until 1790. It was originally a hunting lodge, built in 1624, by Louis XIII. When the Palace of Versailles was completed, it could accomodate up to 5,000 people, including servants. About 37,000 acres of land were cleared to make room for tree-lined terraces and flower plants. It holds the famous Hall of Mirrors.

properties.name: The Palace of Westminster
properties.description: Posted by Melissa23EnglandThe site of the Houses of Parliament is the Palace of Westminster, a royal palace and former residence of kings. Its existing buildings contain nearly 1,200 rooms, 100 staircases and well over 2 miles of passages. There has been many fires at the Palace that has interrupted the building of it. The Royal Gallery is 33 m long, 13 m high and 13 m wide. The Queen walks through it on her way to the Chamber of the House of Lords on the occasion of the State Opening of Parliament. There are amny rooms just for certain events and rooms that are not even used regulary.
